sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The historians guide in two parts : first, The recovery of lost time ... translated out of Italian : second, Englands remembrancer ... Doglioni, Giovanni Nicolò, 1548-1629. Compendio del mondo universale. Clarke, Samuel, 1599-1682. England's remembrancer.
122 [i.e. 130], [5] p.
Printed for W. Crook ..., London : 1676.
Caption title on p. 7: Compendio del mondo universale, or, A compendious chronology of the world. Doglioni's work may be an abridged translation of: Compendio historico universale di tutte le cose notabili successe nel mondo dal principio della sua creatione sin'hora. "England's remembrancer" is writtten by Samuel Clarke. Cf. NUC pre-l956. Each part has special t.p. Advertisement on p. [1]-[5] at end. This item appears at reel 348:3 as Wing C4519 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), and at reel 1720:3 as Wing H2094A. Reproduction of originals in Huntington LIbrary and Harvard University Library. The recovery of lost time / reduced to this form by John Nicolo Doglioni -- Englands remembrancer / written by a lover of his king and countrey.
=======
The historians guide in two parts : first, The recovery of lost time ... translated out of Italian : second, Englands remembrancer ... Doglioni, Giovanni Nicolò, 1548-1629. Compendio del mondo universale. Clarke, Samuel, 1599-1682. England's remembrancer.
122 [i.e. 130], [5] p.
Printed for W. Crook ..., London : 1676.
Caption title on p. 7: Compendio del mondo universale, or, A compendious chronology of the world. Doglioni's work may be an abridged translation of: Compendio historico universale di tutte le cose notabili successe nel mondo dal principio della sua creatione sin'hora. "England's remembrancer" is writtten by Samuel Clarke. Cf. NUC pre-l956. Each part has special t.p. Advertisement on p. [1]-[5] at end. This item appears at reel 348:3 as Wing C4519 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.), and at reel 1720:3 as Wing H2094A. Reproduction of originals in Huntington LIbrary and Harvard University Library. The recovery of lost time / reduced to this form by John Nicolo Doglioni -- Englands remembrancer / written by a lover of his king and countrey.
W. Crook
